ns8:component-version-script.script:
rem NAME rem install.bat rem rem LAST MODIFIED rem 4-October-2012 rem rem SYNOPSIS rem This script test the supported OS and changes the Admin Passsword rem rem LICENSE rem AUTHOR rem Shweta Malhotra rem Persistent Systems Limited
echo Test for the supported OS @echo off systeminfo | find "OS Name" > %TEMP%\osname.txt FOR /F "usebackq delims=: tokens=2" %%i IN (%TEMP%\osname.txt) DO set vers=%%i echo %vers% | find "Windows Server 2008" > nul if %ERRORLEVEL% == 0 ( echo "Supported OS" ) ELSE ( echo UnSupported OS" exit /B 1 ) echo Changing local admin password net user Administrator %password%

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 >%3 2>&1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script:
rem NAME rem configure.bat rem rem LAST MODIFIED rem 4-October-2012 rem rem SYNOPSIS rem rem DESCRIPTION rem This script configures Active Directory Set up rem rem USAGE rem rem LICENSE rem rem AUTHOR rem Shweta Malhotra rem Persistent Systems Limited
@echo off
rem Checking for the existence for dcpromo IF EXIST C:\Windows\System32\dcpromo.exe (
rem Validate Mandatory Arguments for AD Setup rem mandatory_args dnsname netbios password if "x%dnsname%"=="x" ( set errormessage="Mandatory Parameter dnsname is not defined for ADSetup" echo %errormessage% exit /B 1 ) if "x%safepass%"=="x" ( set errormessage="Mandatory Parameter SafeModeAdminPassword is not defined for ADSetup" echo %errormessage% exit /B 1 ) echo "Configuring Active Directory with properties:" echo ReplicaorNewDomain:Domain echo NewDomain:Forest echo ForestLevel:4 echo DomainLevel:4 echo InstallDNS:Yes echo NewDomainDNSName: %dnsname% echo DomainNetbiosName:%netbios% echo DatabasePath:%dbpath% echo LogPath:%logpath% echo SYSVOLPath:%svpath% echo SafeModeAdminPassword:%safepass%
rem AD-Setup with dcpromo echo "Installing AD" C:\Windows\System32\dcpromo.exe /unattend /ReplicaorNewDomain:Domain /NewDomain:Forest /NewDomainDNSName=%dnsname% /ForestLevel:4 /DomainLevel:4 /InstallDNS:Yes /DomainNetbiosName:%netbios% /DatabasePath:%dbpath% /LogPath:%logpath% /SYSVOLPath:%svpath% /SafeModeAdminPassword:%safepass% /RebootOnCompletion:No /RebootOnSuccess:No ) ELSE ( echo "File does not exist" ) IF %ERRORLEVEL% LEQ 10 ( echo "AD Installed Successfully" exit /B 0 ) ELSE ( echo "AD is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 >%3 2>&1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Name start.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # Script: # Create and configure a server authentication certificate in IIS # Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server
# Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
# Fetching the host name $computer=gc env:computername write-output $computer
#Create and Configure Server authentication certificate in IIS
function New-SSLCertificate { <# This function creates self-signed SSL certificate and install it to certificate store
Parameter Subject:Specifies subject for certificate.
KeyLength : Specifies private key length. Due of performance and security reasons, only 1024 and 2048 bit are supported. by default 2048 bit key length is used.
NotBefore:By default current date and time is used.
NotAfter : Sets the date in local time after which a certificate is no longer valid. #>
[CmdletBinding()] param ( [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)] [Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName]$Subject, [int][ValidateSet("1024", "2048")]$KeyLength = 2048, [datetime]$NotBefore = [DateTime]::Now, [datetime]$NotAfter = $NotBefore.AddDays(365), [switch]$Force )
$SubjectDN = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX500DistinguishedName $SubjectDN.Encode($Subject.Name, 0x0)
$OID = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectID $OID.InitializeFromValue("1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1") $OIDs = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectIDs $OIDs.Add($OID)
$EKU = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509ExtensionEnhancedKeyUsage $EKU.InitializeEncode($OIDs)
$PrivateKey = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509PrivateKey $PrivateKey.ProviderName = "Microsoft RSA SChannel Cryptographic Provider" $PrivateKey.KeySpec = 0x1 $PrivateKey.KeyUsage = 0xa0 $PrivateKey.Length = $KeyLength $PrivateKey.MachineContext = 0x1 $PrivateKey.ExportPolicy = 1 $PrivateKey.Create()
$Cert = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509CertificateRequestCertificate $Cert.InitializeFromPrivateKey(0x2,$PrivateKey,"") $Cert.Subject = $SubjectDN $Cert.Issuer = $Cert.Subject $Cert.NotBefore = $NotBefore $Cert.NotAfter = $NotAfter $Cert.X509Extensions.Add($EKU) $Cert.Encode()
$Request = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509enrollment # process request $Request.InitializeFromRequest($Cert) $endCert = $Request.CreateRequest(0x1) $Request.InstallResponse(0x2,$endCert,0x1,"")
[Byte[]]$bytes = [System.Convert]::FromBase64String($endCert) $x509store = New-Object Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store "Root", "LocalMachine" $x509store.Open([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $x509store.Add([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2]$bytes) $x509store.Close() }
function Import-PfxCertificate { param([String]$certPath,[String]$certRootStore,[String]$certStore,$pfxPass)
$pfx = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2
if ($pfxPass -eq $null) { $pfxPass = write-output Enter the pfx password exit }
$pfx.import($certPath,$pfxPass,Exportable,PersistKeySet) $store = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store($certStore,$certRootStore) $store.open(MaxAllowed) $store.add($pfx) $store.close() }
function Import-Certificate([string]$Path, [string]$Password, [string]$Container) { <# This function imports the User certificates to Certificate Store
Parameter
Path:Specifies the path to certificate file Password:Specifies the password for the certificate Container:Specifies container within particular Certificate Store location. These containers represent MMC console containers: CA - Intermediate CAs My - Personal Root- Trusted Root CAs
#>
$Storage = "LocalMachine"
if (!(Resolve-Path $Path)) {throw "Looks like your specified certificate file doesn't exist"} $file = gi $Path -Force -ErrorAction Stop $certs = New-Object system.security.cryptography.x509certificates.x509certificate2 switch ($Storage) {
"LocalMachine" {$flags = "MachineKeySet"} } switch -regex ($file.Extension) { ".CER|.DER" {$certs.Import($file.FullName, $null, $flags)} ".PFX" { if (!$password) {throw "For this certificate file password is required." exit } if ($StrongProtection -and $Storage -eq "Computer") { throw "You cannot use Private Key Strong Protection for computer certificates!" } $flags = $flags + ", Exportable" $flags = $flags + ", UserProtected" $certs.Import($file.FullName, $password, $flags) } ".P7B|.SST" { $certs = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection $certs.Import([System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($file.FullName)) } default {throw "Specified file is not a certificate file"} } $store = New-Object system.security.cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store $Container, $Storage $store.Open([System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $certs | %{$store.Add($_)} if ($?) { write-output "File is successfully added to container" } $store.Close() }
if($usercert -eq "") { write-output "Create the Self Signed Certificate" New-SSLCertificate -Subject "CN=$computer.$domain" } else {
if ($usercert -like "*.pfx" -and $usercertpb -like "*.p7b") { write-output "Download the User Certificate provided" $clnt = new-object System.Net.WebClient $file="C:\$computer.pfx" $pbfile="C:\$computer.p7b" $clnt.DownloadFile($usercert,$file) $clnt.DownloadFile($usercertpb,$pbfile)
write-output "Import the User Certificate" Import-PfxCertificate $file localMachine "MY $usercert_password Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "CA" Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "Root" write-output "User Certificate Imported" } else { write-output "Check the User Certificate file format" exit } }
if(get-childitem cert:\LocalMachine\my | ft issuer, subject) { write-output "Certificate is present in the store" #Import the PowerShell Modules required for configuring IIS Get-Module -ListAvailable | Import-Module cd IIS:
# Extracting thumbprint of the Self Signed Certificate $sslcertificate1=dir cert:\localMachine\MY $thumb=$sslcertificate1.Thumbprint write-output "Thumbprint of the Certificate :" $thumb
#Creating Binding with Self Signed Certificate for the default Web-Site set-variable -name protocol -value https set-variable -name site -value "Default Web Site" New-WebBinding -Name $site -IP "*" -Port 443 -Protocol $protocol Get-WebBinding $site cd SslBindings Get-Item cert:\localMachine\MY\$thumb|New-Item 0.0.0.0!443
# Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server cd "C:\Program Files\Active Directory Federation Services 2.0" ./FSConfig.exe StandAlone /AutoCertRolloverEnabled if ($?) { write-output "Configured the computer as a stand-alone federation server successfully" } else { write-output "Computer not configured as as a stand-alone federation server" exit } } else { write-output "SSL certificate does not exists in the store" exit }

rem Name configure.bat
rem LAST Modified rem 12-October-2012
rem SYNOPSIS rem This script install the ADFS software
rem Author rem Persistent Systems Ltd rem Shweta Malhotra
echo "Install ADFS in silent mode" %adfsinstalller% /quiet
IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 ( echo "ADFS installed successfully" ) ELSE ( echo "ADFS is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 >%3 2>&1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Name install.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # This script adds the machine to AD Domain # Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
write-output "Changing local admin password" net user Administrator $local_admin_pass
write-output "Updating DNS server in network settings" $wmi = Get-WmiObject win32_networkadapterconfiguration -filter "ipenabled = 'true'" $wmi.SetDNSServerSearchOrder("$dns_ip") write-output "DNS set to : " $dns_ip
write-output "Adding machine to domain " $domain Add-Computer -DomainName $domain -credential (New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ("$domain\$domain_admin", (ConvertTo-SecureString $domain_pass -AsPlainText -Force))) if($?) { write-output "Host added to domain successfully" } else { write-output "Host is not added to domain" exit }

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Name start.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # Script: # Create and configure a server authentication certificate in IIS # Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server
# Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
# Fetching the host name $computer=gc env:computername write-output $computer
#Create and Configure Server authentication certificate in IIS
function New-SSLCertificate { <# This function creates self-signed SSL certificate and install it to certificate store
Parameter Subject:Specifies subject for certificate.
KeyLength : Specifies private key length. Due of performance and security reasons, only 1024 and 2048 bit are supported. by default 2048 bit key length is used.
NotBefore:By default current date and time is used.
NotAfter : Sets the date in local time after which a certificate is no longer valid. #>
[CmdletBinding()] param ( [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)] [Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName]$Subject, [int][ValidateSet("1024", "2048")]$KeyLength = 2048, [datetime]$NotBefore = [DateTime]::Now, [datetime]$NotAfter = $NotBefore.AddDays(365), [switch]$Force )
$SubjectDN = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX500DistinguishedName $SubjectDN.Encode($Subject.Name, 0x0)
$OID = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectID $OID.InitializeFromValue("1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1") $OIDs = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectIDs $OIDs.Add($OID)
$EKU = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509ExtensionEnhancedKeyUsage $EKU.InitializeEncode($OIDs)
$PrivateKey = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509PrivateKey $PrivateKey.ProviderName = "Microsoft RSA SChannel Cryptographic Provider" $PrivateKey.KeySpec = 0x1 $PrivateKey.KeyUsage = 0xa0 $PrivateKey.Length = $KeyLength $PrivateKey.MachineContext = 0x1 $PrivateKey.ExportPolicy = 1 $PrivateKey.Create()
$Cert = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509CertificateRequestCertificate $Cert.InitializeFromPrivateKey(0x2,$PrivateKey,"") $Cert.Subject = $SubjectDN $Cert.Issuer = $Cert.Subject $Cert.NotBefore = $NotBefore $Cert.NotAfter = $NotAfter $Cert.X509Extensions.Add($EKU) $Cert.Encode()
$Request = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509enrollment # process request $Request.InitializeFromRequest($Cert) $endCert = $Request.CreateRequest(0x1) $Request.InstallResponse(0x2,$endCert,0x1,"")
[Byte[]]$bytes = [System.Convert]::FromBase64String($endCert) $x509store = New-Object Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store "Root", "LocalMachine" $x509store.Open([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $x509store.Add([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2]$bytes) $x509store.Close() }
function Import-PfxCertificate { param([String]$certPath,[String]$certRootStore,[String]$certStore,$pfxPass)
$pfx = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2
if ($pfxPass -eq $null) { $pfxPass = write-output Enter the pfx password exit }
$pfx.import($certPath,$pfxPass,Exportable,PersistKeySet) $store = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store($certStore,$certRootStore) $store.open(MaxAllowed) $store.add($pfx) $store.close() }
function Import-Certificate([string]$Path, [string]$Password, [string]$Container) { <# This function imports the User certificates to Certificate Store
Parameter
Path:Specifies the path to certificate file Password:Specifies the password for the certificate Container:Specifies container within particular Certificate Store location. These containers represent MMC console containers: CA - Intermediate CAs My - Personal Root- Trusted Root CAs
#>
$Storage = "LocalMachine"
if (!(Resolve-Path $Path)) {throw "Looks like your specified certificate file doesn't exist"} $file = gi $Path -Force -ErrorAction Stop $certs = New-Object system.security.cryptography.x509certificates.x509certificate2 switch ($Storage) {
"LocalMachine" {$flags = "MachineKeySet"} } switch -regex ($file.Extension) { ".CER|.DER" {$certs.Import($file.FullName, $null, $flags)} ".PFX" { if (!$password) {throw "For this certificate file password is required." exit } if ($StrongProtection -and $Storage -eq "Computer") { throw "You cannot use Private Key Strong Protection for computer certificates!" } $flags = $flags + ", Exportable" $flags = $flags + ", UserProtected" $certs.Import($file.FullName, $password, $flags) } ".P7B|.SST" { $certs = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection $certs.Import([System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($file.FullName)) } default {throw "Specified file is not a certificate file"} } $store = New-Object system.security.cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store $Container, $Storage $store.Open([System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $certs | %{$store.Add($_)} if ($?) { write-output "File is successfully added to container" } $store.Close() }
if($usercert -eq "") { write-output "Create the Self Signed Certificate" New-SSLCertificate -Subject "CN=$computer.$domain" } else {
if ($usercert -like "*.pfx" -and $usercertpb -like "*.p7b") { write-output "Download the User Certificate provided" $clnt = new-object System.Net.WebClient $file="C:\$computer.pfx" $pbfile="C:\$computer.p7b" $clnt.DownloadFile($usercert,$file) $clnt.DownloadFile($usercertpb,$pbfile)
write-output "Import the User Certificate" Import-PfxCertificate $file localMachine "MY $usercert_password Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "CA" Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "Root" write-output "User Certificate Imported" } else { write-output "Check the User Certificate file format" exit } }
if(get-childitem cert:\LocalMachine\my | ft issuer, subject) { write-output "Certificate is present in the store" #Import the PowerShell Modules required for configuring IIS Get-Module -ListAvailable | Import-Module cd IIS:
# Extracting thumbprint of the Self Signed Certificate $sslcertificate1=dir cert:\localMachine\MY $thumb=$sslcertificate1.Thumbprint write-output "Thumbprint of the Certificate :" $thumb
#Creating Binding with Self Signed Certificate for the default Web-Site set-variable -name protocol -value https set-variable -name site -value "Default Web Site" New-WebBinding -Name $site -IP "*" -Port 443 -Protocol $protocol Get-WebBinding $site cd SslBindings Get-Item cert:\localMachine\MY\$thumb|New-Item 0.0.0.0!443
# Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server cd "C:\Program Files\Active Directory Federation Services 2.0" ./FSConfig.exe StandAlone /AutoCertRolloverEnabled if ($?) { write-output "Configured the computer as a stand-alone federation server successfully" } else { write-output "Computer not configured as as a stand-alone federation server" exit } } else { write-output "SSL certificate does not exists in the store" exit }

rem LAST Modified rem 12-October-2012

rem Author rem Persistent Systems Ltd rem Shweta Malhotra
echo "Install ADFS in silent mode" %adfsinstalller% /quiet
IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 ( echo "ADFS installed successfully" ) ELSE ( echo "ADFS is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Name install.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # This script adds the machine to AD Domain # Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
write-output "Changing local admin password" net user Administrator $local_admin_pass
write-output "Updating DNS server in network settings" $wmi = Get-WmiObject win32_networkadapterconfiguration -filter "ipenabled = 'true'" $wmi.SetDNSServerSearchOrder("$dns_ip") write-output "DNS set to : " $dns_ip
write-output "Adding machine to domain " $domain Add-Computer -DomainName $domain -credential (New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ("$domain\$domain_admin", (ConvertTo-SecureString $domain_pass -AsPlainText -Force))) if($?) { write-output "Host added to domain successfully" } else { write-output "Host is not added to domain" exit }

task.content:
rem NAME rem install.bat rem rem LAST MODIFIED rem 4-October-2012 rem rem SYNOPSIS rem This script test the supported OS and changes the Admin Passsword rem rem LICENSE rem AUTHOR rem Shweta Malhotra rem Persistent Systems Limited
echo Test for the supported OS @echo off systeminfo | find "OS Name" > %TEMP%\osname.txt FOR /F "usebackq delims=: tokens=2" %%i IN (%TEMP%\osname.txt) DO set vers=%%i echo %vers% | find "Windows Server 2008" > nul if %ERRORLEVEL% == 0 ( echo "Supported OS" ) ELSE ( echo UnSupported OS" exit /B 1 ) echo Changing local admin password net user Administrator %password%

rem NAME rem configure.bat rem rem LAST MODIFIED rem 4-October-2012 rem rem SYNOPSIS rem rem DESCRIPTION rem This script configures Active Directory Set up rem rem USAGE rem rem LICENSE rem rem AUTHOR rem Shweta Malhotra rem Persistent Systems Limited
@echo off
rem Checking for the existence for dcpromo IF EXIST C:\Windows\System32\dcpromo.exe (
rem Validate Mandatory Arguments for AD Setup rem mandatory_args dnsname netbios password if "x%dnsname%"=="x" ( set errormessage="Mandatory Parameter dnsname is not defined for ADSetup" echo %errormessage% exit /B 1 ) if "x%safepass%"=="x" ( set errormessage="Mandatory Parameter SafeModeAdminPassword is not defined for ADSetup" echo %errormessage% exit /B 1 ) echo "Configuring Active Directory with properties:" echo ReplicaorNewDomain:Domain echo NewDomain:Forest echo ForestLevel:4 echo DomainLevel:4 echo InstallDNS:Yes echo NewDomainDNSName: %dnsname% echo DomainNetbiosName:%netbios% echo DatabasePath:%dbpath% echo LogPath:%logpath% echo SYSVOLPath:%svpath% echo SafeModeAdminPassword:%safepass%
rem AD-Setup with dcpromo echo "Installing AD" C:\Windows\System32\dcpromo.exe /unattend /ReplicaorNewDomain:Domain /NewDomain:Forest /NewDomainDNSName=%dnsname% /ForestLevel:4 /DomainLevel:4 /InstallDNS:Yes /DomainNetbiosName:%netbios% /DatabasePath:%dbpath% /LogPath:%logpath% /SYSVOLPath:%svpath% /SafeModeAdminPassword:%safepass% /RebootOnCompletion:No /RebootOnSuccess:No ) ELSE ( echo "File does not exist" ) IF %ERRORLEVEL% LEQ 10 ( echo "AD Installed Successfully" exit /B 0 ) ELSE ( echo "AD is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

# Name start.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # Script: # Create and configure a server authentication certificate in IIS # Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server
# Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
# Fetching the host name $computer=gc env:computername write-output $computer
#Create and Configure Server authentication certificate in IIS
function New-SSLCertificate { <# .Synopsis Creates self-signed SSL certificate and install it to certificate store .Description This function generates self-signed certificate with some pre-defined and user-definable settings. User may elect to perform complete certificate installation, by installing generated certificate to Trusted Root Certification Authorities.
.Parameter Subject Specifies subject for certificate. This parameter must be entered in X500 Distinguished Name format. The name must match web site name.
.Parameter KeyLength Specifies private key length. Due of performance and security reasons, only 1024 and 2048 bit are supported. by default 2048 bit key length is used.
.Parameter NotBefore Sets the date in local time on which a certificate becomes valid. By default current date and time is used.
.Parameter NotAfter Sets the date in local time after which a certificate is no longer valid. By default certificate is valid for 365 days.
#> [CmdletBinding()] param ( [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)] [Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName]$Subject, [int][ValidateSet("1024", "2048")]$KeyLength = 2048, [datetime]$NotBefore = [DateTime]::Now, [datetime]$NotAfter = $NotBefore.AddDays(365), [switch]$Force ) $SubjectDN = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX500DistinguishedName $SubjectDN.Encode($Subject.Name, 0x0)
$OID = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectID $OID.InitializeFromValue("1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1") $OIDs = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectIDs $OIDs.Add($OID)
$EKU = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509ExtensionEnhancedKeyUsage $EKU.InitializeEncode($OIDs)
$PrivateKey = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509PrivateKey $PrivateKey.ProviderName = "Microsoft RSA SChannel Cryptographic Provider" $PrivateKey.KeySpec = 0x1 $PrivateKey.KeyUsage = 0xa0 $PrivateKey.Length = $KeyLength $PrivateKey.MachineContext = 0x1 $PrivateKey.ExportPolicy = 1 $PrivateKey.Create()
$Cert = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509CertificateRequestCertificate $Cert.InitializeFromPrivateKey(0x2,$PrivateKey,"") $Cert.Subject = $SubjectDN $Cert.Issuer = $Cert.Subject $Cert.NotBefore = $NotBefore $Cert.NotAfter = $NotAfter $Cert.X509Extensions.Add($EKU) $Cert.Encode()
$Request = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509enrollment # process request $Request.InitializeFromRequest($Cert) $endCert = $Request.CreateRequest(0x1) $Request.InstallResponse(0x2,$endCert,0x1,"")
[Byte[]]$bytes = [System.Convert]::FromBase64String($endCert) $x509store = New-Object Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store "Root", "LocalMachine" $x509store.Open([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $x509store.Add([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2]$bytes) $x509store.Close() }
function Import-PfxCertificate {
param([String]$certPath,[String]$certRootStore,[String]$certStore,$pfxPass) $pfx = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 if ($pfxPass -eq $null) {$pfxPass = read-host Enter the pfx password -assecurestring} $pfx.import($certPath,$pfxPass,Exportable,PersistKeySet) $store = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store($certStore,$certRootStore) $store.open(MaxAllowed) $store.add($pfx) $store.close() }
function Import-Certificate([string]$Path, [string]$Password, [string]$Container ) { <# .Synopsis Imports digital certificates to Certificate Store from files .Description Improrts digital certificates to Certificate Store from various types of certificates files, such .CER, .DER, .PFX (password required), .P7B. .Parameter Path Specifies the path to certificate file .Parameter Password Specifies password to PFX/PKCS#12 file only. For other certificate types is not required.
Note: this parameter must be passed as SecureString. .Parameter Storage Specifies place in Sertificate Store for certificate. For user certificates (default) you MAY specify 'User' and importing certificate will be stored in CurrentUser Certificate Store. For computer certificates you MUST specify 'Computer' and importing certificates will be stored in LocalMachine Certificate Store. .Parameter Container Specifies container within particular Certificate Store location. Container may be one of AuthRoot/CA/Disallowed/My/REQUEST/Root/SmartCardRoot/Trust/TrustedPeople/ TrustedPublisher/UserDS. These containers represent MMC console containers as follows: AddressBook - AddressBook AuthRoot - Third-Party Root CAs CA - Intermediate CAs Disallowed - Untrused Certificates My - Personal REQUEST - Certificate Enrollment Requests Root - Trusted Root CAs SmartCardRoot - Smart Card Trusted Roots Trust - Enterprise Trust TrustedPeople - Trusted People TrustedPublishers - Trusted Publishers UserDS - Active Directory User Object .Parameter Exportable Marks imported certificates private key as exportable. May be used only for PFX files only. If this switch is not presented for PFX files, after importing you will not be able to export this certificate with private key again. .Parameter StrongProtection Enables private key strong protection that requires user password each time when certificate private key is used. Not available for computer certificates, because computers certificates are used under LocalSystem account and here is no UI for user to type password. .Outputs This command provide a simple message if the export is successful. #>
$Storage = "LocalMachine"
if (!(Resolve-Path $Path)) {throw "Looks like your specified certificate file doesn't exist"} $file = gi $Path -Force -ErrorAction Stop $certs = New-Object system.security.cryptography.x509certificates.x509certificate2 switch ($Storage) { "CurrentUser" {$flags = "UserKeySet"} "LocalMachine" {$flags = "MachineKeySet"} } switch -regex ($file.Extension) { ".CER|.DER" {$certs.Import($file.FullName, $null, $flags)} ".PFX" { if (!$password) {throw "For PFX files password is required."} if ($StrongProtection -and $Storage -eq "Computer") { throw "You cannot use Private Key Strong Protection for computer certificates!" } $flags = $flags + ", Exportable" $flags = $flags + ", UserProtected" $certs.Import($file.FullName, $password, $flags) } ".P7B|.SST" { $certs = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection $certs.Import([System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($file.FullName)) } default {throw "Looks like your specified file is not a certificate file"} } $store = New-Object system.security.cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store $Container, $Storage $store.Open([System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $certs | %{$store.Add($_)} if ($?) {Write-Host -ForegroundColor Green Certificate file`: $file.fullname was successfully added to $Container container} $store.Close() }
if($usercert -eq "") { write-output "Create the Self Signed Certificate" write-output "User Certificate is not provided" New-SSLCertificate -Subject "CN=$computer.$domain" } else { write-output "Download the User Certificate provided" $clnt = new-object System.Net.WebClient $file="C:\ADFSnew.pfx" $pbfile="C:\ADFSnew.p7b" $clnt.DownloadFile($usercert,$file) $clnt.DownloadFile($usercertpb,$pbfile)
write-output "Import the User Certificate" Import-PfxCertificate $file localMachine "MY $usercert_password Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "CA" Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "Root" write-output "User Certificate Imported"
}
if(get-childitem cert:\LocalMachine\my | ft issuer, subject) { write-output "Certificate is present in the store" #Import the PowerShell Modules required for configuring IIS Get-Module -ListAvailable | Import-Module cd IIS:
# Extracting thumbprint of the Self Signed Certificate $sslcertificate1=dir cert:\localMachine\MY $thumb=$sslcertificate1.Thumbprint write-output "Thumbprint of the Self Signed Certificate :" $thumb
#Creating Binding with Self Signed Certificate for the default Web-Site set-variable -name protocol -value https set-variable -name site -value "Default Web Site" New-WebBinding -Name $site -IP "*" -Port 443 -Protocol $protocol Get-WebBinding $site cd SslBindings Get-Item cert:\localMachine\MY\$thumb|New-Item 0.0.0.0!443
# Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server cd "C:\Program Files\Active Directory Federation Services 2.0" ./FSConfig.exe StandAlone /AutoCertRolloverEnabled if ($?) { write-output "Configured the computer as a stand-alone federation server successfully" } else { write-output "Computer not configured as as a stand-alone federation server" exit } } else { write-output "SSL certificate does not exists in the store" exit }

# Name install.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # This script adds the machine to AD Domain # Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
write-output "Changing local admin password" net user Administrator $local_admin_pass
write-output "Updating DNS server in network settings" $wmi = Get-WmiObject win32_networkadapterconfiguration -filter "ipenabled = 'true'" $wmi.SetDNSServerSearchOrder("$dns_ip") write-output "DNS set to : " $dns_ip
write-output "Adding machine to domain " $domain Add-Computer -DomainName $domain -credential (New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ("$domain\$domain_admin", (ConvertTo-SecureString $domain_pass -AsPlainText -Force))) if($?) { write-output "Host added to domain successfully" } else { write-output "Host is not added to domain" exit }

rem Name configure.bat
rem LAST Modified rem 12-October-2012
rem SYNOPSIS rem This script install the ADFS software
rem Author rem Persistent Systems Ltd rem Shweta Malhotra
echo "Install ADFS in silent mode" %adfsinstalller% /quiet
IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 ( echo "ADFS installed successfully" ) ELSE ( echo "ADFS is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

rem NAME rem install.bat rem rem LAST MODIFIED rem 4-October-2012 rem rem SYNOPSIS rem This script test the supported OS and changes the Admin Passsword rem rem LICENSE rem AUTHOR rem Shweta Malhotra rem Persistent Systems Limited
echo Test for the supported OS @echo off systeminfo | find "OS Name" > %TEMP%\osname.txt FOR /F "usebackq delims=: tokens=2" %%i IN (%TEMP%\osname.txt) DO set vers=%%i echo %vers% | find "Windows Server 2008" > nul if %ERRORLEVEL% == 0 ( echo "Supported OS" ) ELSE ( echo UnSupported OS" exit /B 1 ) echo Changing local admin password net user Administrator %password%

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 >%3 2>&1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script:
rem NAME rem configure.bat rem rem LAST MODIFIED rem 4-October-2012 rem rem SYNOPSIS rem rem DESCRIPTION rem This script configures Active Directory Set up rem rem USAGE rem rem LICENSE rem rem AUTHOR rem Shweta Malhotra rem Persistent Systems Limited
@echo off
rem Checking for the existence for dcpromo IF EXIST C:\Windows\System32\dcpromo.exe (
rem Validate Mandatory Arguments for AD Setup rem mandatory_args dnsname netbios password if "x%dnsname%"=="x" ( set errormessage="Mandatory Parameter dnsname is not defined for ADSetup" echo %errormessage% exit /B 1 ) if "x%safepass%"=="x" ( set errormessage="Mandatory Parameter SafeModeAdminPassword is not defined for ADSetup" echo %errormessage% exit /B 1 ) echo "Configuring Active Directory with properties:" echo ReplicaorNewDomain:Domain echo NewDomain:Forest echo ForestLevel:4 echo DomainLevel:4 echo InstallDNS:Yes echo NewDomainDNSName: %dnsname% echo DomainNetbiosName:%netbios% echo DatabasePath:%dbpath% echo LogPath:%logpath% echo SYSVOLPath:%svpath% echo SafeModeAdminPassword:%safepass%
rem AD-Setup with dcpromo echo "Installing AD" C:\Windows\System32\dcpromo.exe /unattend /ReplicaorNewDomain:Domain /NewDomain:Forest /NewDomainDNSName=%dnsname% /ForestLevel:4 /DomainLevel:4 /InstallDNS:Yes /DomainNetbiosName:%netbios% /DatabasePath:%dbpath% /LogPath:%logpath% /SYSVOLPath:%svpath% /SafeModeAdminPassword:%safepass% /RebootOnCompletion:No /RebootOnSuccess:No ) ELSE ( echo "File does not exist" ) IF %ERRORLEVEL% LEQ 10 ( echo "AD Installed Successfully" exit /B 0 ) ELSE ( echo "AD is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

supported-os-details.exec-script: @echo off call %1 >%3 2>&1 if NOT %errorlevel% EQU 0 exit %errorlevel% set > %2

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Name start.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # Script: # Create and configure a server authentication certificate in IIS # Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server
# Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
# Fetching the host name $computer=gc env:computername write-output $computer
#Create and Configure Server authentication certificate in IIS
function New-SSLCertificate { <# This function creates self-signed SSL certificate and install it to certificate store
Parameter Subject:Specifies subject for certificate.
KeyLength : Specifies private key length. Due of performance and security reasons, only 1024 and 2048 bit are supported. by default 2048 bit key length is used.
NotBefore:By default current date and time is used.
NotAfter : Sets the date in local time after which a certificate is no longer valid. #>
[CmdletBinding()] param ( [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)] [Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName]$Subject, [int][ValidateSet("1024", "2048")]$KeyLength = 2048, [datetime]$NotBefore = [DateTime]::Now, [datetime]$NotAfter = $NotBefore.AddDays(365), [switch]$Force )
$SubjectDN = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX500DistinguishedName $SubjectDN.Encode($Subject.Name, 0x0)
$OID = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectID $OID.InitializeFromValue("1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1") $OIDs = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectIDs $OIDs.Add($OID)
$EKU = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509ExtensionEnhancedKeyUsage $EKU.InitializeEncode($OIDs)
$PrivateKey = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509PrivateKey $PrivateKey.ProviderName = "Microsoft RSA SChannel Cryptographic Provider" $PrivateKey.KeySpec = 0x1 $PrivateKey.KeyUsage = 0xa0 $PrivateKey.Length = $KeyLength $PrivateKey.MachineContext = 0x1 $PrivateKey.ExportPolicy = 1 $PrivateKey.Create()
$Cert = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509CertificateRequestCertificate $Cert.InitializeFromPrivateKey(0x2,$PrivateKey,"") $Cert.Subject = $SubjectDN $Cert.Issuer = $Cert.Subject $Cert.NotBefore = $NotBefore $Cert.NotAfter = $NotAfter $Cert.X509Extensions.Add($EKU) $Cert.Encode()
$Request = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509enrollment # process request $Request.InitializeFromRequest($Cert) $endCert = $Request.CreateRequest(0x1) $Request.InstallResponse(0x2,$endCert,0x1,"")
[Byte[]]$bytes = [System.Convert]::FromBase64String($endCert) $x509store = New-Object Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store "Root", "LocalMachine" $x509store.Open([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $x509store.Add([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2]$bytes) $x509store.Close() }
function Import-PfxCertificate { param([String]$certPath,[String]$certRootStore,[String]$certStore,$pfxPass)
$pfx = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2
if ($pfxPass -eq $null) { $pfxPass = write-output Enter the pfx password exit }
$pfx.import($certPath,$pfxPass,Exportable,PersistKeySet) $store = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store($certStore,$certRootStore) $store.open(MaxAllowed) $store.add($pfx) $store.close() }
function Import-Certificate([string]$Path, [string]$Password, [string]$Container) { <# This function imports the User certificates to Certificate Store
Parameter
Path:Specifies the path to certificate file Password:Specifies the password for the certificate Container:Specifies container within particular Certificate Store location. These containers represent MMC console containers: CA - Intermediate CAs My - Personal Root- Trusted Root CAs
#>
$Storage = "LocalMachine"
if (!(Resolve-Path $Path)) {throw "Looks like your specified certificate file doesn't exist"} $file = gi $Path -Force -ErrorAction Stop $certs = New-Object system.security.cryptography.x509certificates.x509certificate2 switch ($Storage) {
"LocalMachine" {$flags = "MachineKeySet"} } switch -regex ($file.Extension) { ".CER|.DER" {$certs.Import($file.FullName, $null, $flags)} ".PFX" { if (!$password) {throw "For this certificate file password is required." exit } if ($StrongProtection -and $Storage -eq "Computer") { throw "You cannot use Private Key Strong Protection for computer certificates!" } $flags = $flags + ", Exportable" $flags = $flags + ", UserProtected" $certs.Import($file.FullName, $password, $flags) } ".P7B|.SST" { $certs = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection $certs.Import([System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($file.FullName)) } default {throw "Specified file is not a certificate file"} } $store = New-Object system.security.cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store $Container, $Storage $store.Open([System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $certs | %{$store.Add($_)} if ($?) { write-output "File is successfully added to container" } $store.Close() }
if($usercert -eq "") { write-output "Create the Self Signed Certificate" New-SSLCertificate -Subject "CN=$computer.$domain" } else {
if ($usercert -like "*.pfx" -and $usercertpb -like "*.p7b") { write-output "Download the User Certificate provided" $clnt = new-object System.Net.WebClient $file="C:\$computer.pfx" $pbfile="C:\$computer.p7b" $clnt.DownloadFile($usercert,$file) $clnt.DownloadFile($usercertpb,$pbfile)
write-output "Import the User Certificate" Import-PfxCertificate $file localMachine "MY $usercert_password Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "CA" Import-Certificate $pbfile $usercert_password "Root" write-output "User Certificate Imported" } else { write-output "Check the User Certificate file format" exit } }
if(get-childitem cert:\LocalMachine\my | ft issuer, subject) { write-output "Certificate is present in the store" #Import the PowerShell Modules required for configuring IIS Get-Module -ListAvailable | Import-Module cd IIS:
# Extracting thumbprint of the Self Signed Certificate $sslcertificate1=dir cert:\localMachine\MY $thumb=$sslcertificate1.Thumbprint write-output "Thumbprint of the Certificate :" $thumb
#Creating Binding with Self Signed Certificate for the default Web-Site set-variable -name protocol -value https set-variable -name site -value "Default Web Site" New-WebBinding -Name $site -IP "*" -Port 443 -Protocol $protocol Get-WebBinding $site cd SslBindings Get-Item cert:\localMachine\MY\$thumb|New-Item 0.0.0.0!443
# Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server cd "C:\Program Files\Active Directory Federation Services 2.0" ./FSConfig.exe StandAlone /AutoCertRolloverEnabled if ($?) { write-output "Configured the computer as a stand-alone federation server successfully" } else { write-output "Computer not configured as as a stand-alone federation server" exit } } else { write-output "SSL certificate does not exists in the store" exit }

rem Name configure.bat
rem LAST Modified rem 12-October-2012
rem SYNOPSIS rem This script install the ADFS software
rem Author rem Persistent Systems Ltd rem Shweta Malhotra
echo "Install ADFS in silent mode" %adfsinstalller% /quiet
IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 ( echo "ADFS installed successfully" ) ELSE ( echo "ADFS is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

ns8:component-version-script.script:
# Name install.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # This script adds the machine to AD Domain # Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
write-output "Changing local admin password" net user Administrator $local_admin_pass
write-output "Updating DNS server in network settings" $wmi = Get-WmiObject win32_networkadapterconfiguration -filter "ipenabled = 'true'" $wmi.SetDNSServerSearchOrder("$dns_ip") write-output "DNS set to : " $dns_ip
write-output "Adding machine to domain " $domain Add-Computer -DomainName $domain -credential (New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ("$domain\$domain_admin", (ConvertTo-SecureString $domain_pass -AsPlainText -Force))) if($?) { write-output "Host added to domain successfully" } else { write-output "Host is not added to domain" exit }

@echo off systeminfo | find "OS Name" > %TEMP%\osname.txt FOR /F "usebackq delims=: tokens=2" %%i IN (%TEMP%\osname.txt) DO set vers=%%i echo %vers% | find "Windows Server 2008" > nul if %ERRORLEVEL% == 0 ( echo "Supported OS" ) ELSE ( echo UnSupported OS" exit /B 1 ) echo Changing local admin password net user Administrator %password%

rem NAME rem configure.bat rem rem LAST MODIFIED rem 4-October-2012 rem rem SYNOPSIS rem rem DESCRIPTION rem This script configures Active Directory Set up rem rem USAGE rem rem LICENSE rem rem AUTHOR rem Shweta Malhotra rem Persistent Systems Limited
@echo off
rem Checking for the existence for dcpromo IF EXIST C:\Windows\System32\dcpromo.exe (
rem Validate Mandatory Arguments for AD Setup rem mandatory_args dnsname netbios password if "x%dnsname%"=="x" ( set errormessage="Mandatory Parameter dnsname is not defined for ADSetup" echo %errormessage% exit /B 1 ) if "x%safepass%"=="x" ( set errormessage="Mandatory Parameter SafeModeAdminPassword is not defined for ADSetup" echo %errormessage% exit /B 1 ) echo "Configuring Active Directory with properties:" echo ReplicaorNewDomain:Domain echo NewDomain:Forest echo ForestLevel:4 echo DomainLevel:4 echo InstallDNS:Yes echo NewDomainDNSName: %dnsname% echo DomainNetbiosName:%netbios% echo DatabasePath:%dbpath% echo LogPath:%logpath% echo SYSVOLPath:%svpath% echo SafeModeAdminPassword:%safepass%
# AD-Setup with dcpromo echo "Installing AD" C:\Windows\System32\dcpromo.exe /unattend /ReplicaorNewDomain:Domain /NewDomain:Forest /NewDomainDNSName=%dnsname% /ForestLevel:4 /DomainLevel:4 /InstallDNS:Yes /DomainNetbiosName:%netbios% /DatabasePath:%dbpath% /LogPath:%logpath% /SYSVOLPath:%svpath% /SafeModeAdminPassword:%safepass% /RebootOnCompletion:No /RebootOnSuccess:No ) ELSE ( echo "File does not exist" ) IF %ERRORLEVEL% LEQ 10 ( echo "AD Installed Successfully" # set ERRORLEVEL = 0 exit /B 0 ) ELSE ( echo "AD is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

# Name install.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # This script adds the machine to AD Domain # Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
write-host "Changing local admin password" net user Administrator $local_admin_pass write-host "Updating DNS server in network settings" $wmi = Get-WmiObject win32_networkadapterconfiguration -filter "ipenabled = 'true'" $wmi.SetDNSServerSearchOrder("$dns_ip") write-host "DNS set to : " $dns_ip write-host "Adding machine to domain " $domain Add-Computer -DomainName $domain -credential (New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ("$domain\$domain_admin", (ConvertTo-SecureString $domain_pass -AsPlainText -Force))) if($?) { write-host "Host added to domain successfully" } else { write-host "Host is not added to domain" exit }

rem Name configure.bat
rem LAST Modified rem 12-October-2012
rem SYNOPSIS rem This script install the ADFS software
rem Author rem Persistent Systems Ltd rem Shweta Malhotra
echo "Install ADFS in silent mode" %adfsinstalller% /quiet
IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 ( echo "ADFS installed successfully" ) ELSE ( echo "ADFS is not installed successfully" exit /B 1 )

# Name start.ps1
# LAST Modified # 12-October-2012
# SYNOPSIS # Script: # Create and configure a server authentication certificate in IIS # Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server
# Author # Persistent Systems Ltd # Shweta Malhotra
# Fetching the host name $computer=gc env:computername write-host $computer
#Create and Configure Server authentication certificate in IIS echo $sslcertexists echo $sslcert function New-SSLCertificate { <# .Synopsis Creates self-signed SSL certificate and install it to certificate store .Description This function generates self-signed certificate with some pre-defined and user-definable settings. User may elect to perform complete certificate installation, by installing generated certificate to Trusted Root Certification Authorities.
.Parameter Subject Specifies subject for certificate. This parameter must be entered in X500 Distinguished Name format. The name must match web site name.
.Parameter KeyLength Specifies private key length. Due of performance and security reasons, only 1024 and 2048 bit are supported. by default 2048 bit key length is used.
.Parameter NotBefore Sets the date in local time on which a certificate becomes valid. By default current date and time is used.
.Parameter NotAfter Sets the date in local time after which a certificate is no longer valid. By default certificate is valid for 365 days.
#> [CmdletBinding()] param ( [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)] [Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName]$Subject, [int][ValidateSet("1024", "2048")]$KeyLength = 2048, [datetime]$NotBefore = [DateTime]::Now, [datetime]$NotAfter = $NotBefore.AddDays(365), [switch]$Force ) $SubjectDN = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX500DistinguishedName $SubjectDN.Encode($Subject.Name, 0x0)
$OID = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectID $OID.InitializeFromValue("1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1") $OIDs = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CObjectIDs $OIDs.Add($OID)
$EKU = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509ExtensionEnhancedKeyUsage $EKU.InitializeEncode($OIDs)
$PrivateKey = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509PrivateKey $PrivateKey.ProviderName = "Microsoft RSA SChannel Cryptographic Provider" $PrivateKey.KeySpec = 0x1 $PrivateKey.KeyUsage = 0xa0 $PrivateKey.Length = $KeyLength $PrivateKey.MachineContext = 0x1 $PrivateKey.ExportPolicy = 1 $PrivateKey.Create()
$Cert = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509CertificateRequestCertificate $Cert.InitializeFromPrivateKey(0x2,$PrivateKey,"") $Cert.Subject = $SubjectDN $Cert.Issuer = $Cert.Subject $Cert.NotBefore = $NotBefore $Cert.NotAfter = $NotAfter $Cert.X509Extensions.Add($EKU) $Cert.Encode()
$Request = New-Object -ComObject X509Enrollment.CX509enrollment # process request $Request.InitializeFromRequest($Cert) $endCert = $Request.CreateRequest(0x1) $Request.InstallResponse(0x2,$endCert,0x1,"")
[Byte[]]$bytes = [System.Convert]::FromBase64String($endCert) $x509store = New-Object Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store "Root", "LocalMachine" $x509store.Open([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags]::ReadWrite) $x509store.Add([Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2]$bytes) $x509store.Close() }
function Import-PfxCertificate {
param([String]$certPath,[String]$certRootStore,[String]$certStore,$pfxPass) $pfx = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2
if ($pfxPass -eq $null) {$pfxPass = read-host Enter the pfx password -assecurestring}
$pfx.import($certPath,$pfxPass,Exportable,PersistKeySet)
$store = new-object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store($certStore,$certRootStore) $store.open(MaxAllowed) $store.add($pfx) $store.close() } echo $sslcertexists
if($sslcertexists -eq "no") { echo "Here" echo $sslcertexists New-SSLCertificate -Subject "CN=$computer.$domain" } else { echo "There" # Import-PfxCertificate $sslcert localMachine "root "adfs" # Import-PfxCertificate $sslcert localMachine "MY "adfs"
}
if(get-childitem cert:\LocalMachine\my | ft issuer, subject) { echo "SSL certificate is present" # Import the PowerShell Modules required for configuring IIS Get-Module -ListAvailable | Import-Module cd IIS:
# Extracting thumbprint of the Self Signed Certificate $sslcertificate1=dir cert:\localMachine\MY $thumb=$sslcertificate1.Thumbprint write-output "Thumbprint of the Self Signed Certificate :" $thumb
#Creating Binding with Self Signed Certificate for the default Web-Site set-variable -name protocol -value https set-variable -name site -value "Default Web Site" New-WebBinding -Name $site -IP "*" -Port 443 -Protocol $protocol Get-WebBinding $site cd SslBindings Get-Item cert:\localMachine\MY\$thumb|New-Item 0.0.0.0!443
# Configure the computer as a stand-alone federation server cd "C:\Program Files\Active Directory Federation Services 2.0" ./FSConfig.exe StandAlone /AutoCertRolloverEnabled if ($?) { echo "Configured the computer as a stand-alone federation server successfully" } else { echo "Computer not configured as as a stand-alone federation server" exit } } else { echo "SSL certificate is not present" exit }
